UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020 families' resilience and coping mechanisms are strengthened and parents know about the importance of the early years

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 gate-keeping mechanism in place to prevent children, particularly U3, from institutionalization

description.narrative: The CO continued a national, inter-sectoral dialogue on de-institutionalization, resulting in;approval of the Plan of interdepartmental measures for the comprehensive deinstitutionalization of children and youth for 2020-2023 led by the Ministry of Education. Partnership with local administrations, CSOs and the private sector contributed to the development of a system providing support to families raising children U4 and CWD that is tailored to needs through a combination of case management, de-institutionalization of children from baby-homes and development of alternative family-based care. Private sector engagement played a critical role in mobilizing resources and building public awareness on this issue. | Status:Met | As-of Date:19/01/2021
